intro: Peucedanum lhasense, commonly known as Lhasa angelica, is a herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Peucedanum lhasense is adapted to cold, arid environments and is valued for its potential therapeutic uses.
